clinical_study.brief_title: Ultrasound-Guided Lumbar Erector Spinae Plane Block Versus Caudal Block for Postoperative Analgesia in Hip and Proximal Femur Surgery in Pediatric Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Ultrasound-Guided Lumbar Erector Spinae Plane Block Versus Caudal Block for Postoperative Analgesia in Hip and Proximal Femur Surgery in Pediatric Patients: A Prospective Randomized Controlled Study

brief_summary.textblock: The study will compare Ultrasound-Guided Lumbar Erector Spinae Plane Block and caudal block for Postoperative Analgesia in Hip and Proximal Femur Surgery in pediatric patients

primary_outcome.description: Depending on age and cognitive abilities only one score will be obtained either visual analog scale [VAS] or face, legs, activity, and cry consolability scale [FLACC ] The VAS consists of a 10 centimeters line, with two end points representing 0 ('no pain') and 10 ('pain as bad as it could possibly be') leading to a pain intensity score out of 10 FLACC scale will be measured as following: Each category (face,legs,activity, and cry consolability) is scored on the 0-2 scale which results in a total score of 0-10. Assessment of the final score: 0 = Relaxed and comfortable 1-3 = Mild discomfort 4-6 = Moderate pain 7-10 = Severe discomfort/pain

secondary_outcome.time_frame: at 2 hour intervals during the first 24 hours postoperatively
secondary_outcome.description: Depending on age and cognitive abilities only one score will be obtained either visual analog scale [VAS] or face, legs, activity, and cry consolability scale [FLACC ] The VAS consists of a 10 centimeters line, with two end points representing 0 ('no pain') and 10 ('pain as bad as it could possibly be') leading to a pain intensity score out of 10 FLACC scale will be measured as following: Each category (face,legs,activity, and cry consolability) is scored on the 0-2 scale which results in a total score of 0-10. Assessment of the final score: 0 = Relaxed and comfortable 1-3 = Mild discomfort 4-6 = Moderate pain 7-10 = Severe discomfort/pain
The block will be considered a failed block if the patient required more than two doses of rescue analgesia in the first hour postoperatively

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to one week after the block

secondary_outcome.measure: Degree of contralateral motor blockage and lower limb weakness
secondary_outcome.description: By using modified bromage scale as following: Grade I : Free movement of legs and feet Degree of block :Nil (0%) Grade II :Just able to flex knees with free movement of feet Degree of block :Partial (33%) Grade III :Unable to flex knees, but with free movement of feet Degree of block: Almost complete (66%) Grade IV :Unable to move legs or feet Degree of block: Complete (100%)

intervention.description: the patients will receive a single injection erector spinea block after induction of general anesthesia
the patients will receive caudal epidural block after induction of general anesthesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ASA I-II.
- Scheduled to undergo hip or proximal femur surgeries.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Refusal of participation by parents or caregivers
- Known local anesthetic (LA) drug sensitivity
- Bleeding disorders with INR > 1.5 and/or platelets < 100,000/mm3.
- Skin lesions or wounds at the site of proposed needle insertion.
